title: 3 Roads to GHS Labels with Brady

json.text: Your facility or lab has established a complete library of Material Safety Data Sheets which
are now changing to Safety Data Sheets via the new Hazcom and GHS standard. Now, how
do you get all of that crucial information onto your labels? Not to worry: Brady offers
3 ways to help you arrive at your GHS labeling solution to keep your staff and shipping personnel
safe and informed. You can choose the option that works best for your needs.
The first option is to use Brady’s preprinted labels. If your GHS label needs are minimal,
or if you need a very high quantity of the same label, this is an ideal option. Simply
fill out Brady’s online form or send us your SDS sheets, and your customized GHS pre-printed
labels will be shipped directly to you.
If your GHS labeling demands are more extensive, a great cost-saving option is method #2: to
simply print your own labels with a do-it-yourself sign and label printing system. You can use
your Brady benchtop printer with GHS diamond or pictogram label materials. Additionally,
you can select from sheets or rolls featuring GHS pictograms. Brady software makes it easy
to create and print your labels, as well as store commonly used labels once they’re
created. And with Brady Workstation, you also have the ability to access these labels online,
anywhere!
An added benefit of using a printing system is that you can also use it for other important
applications in your facility or lab, including warning labels, piping labels, equipment labels,
and container, cabinet and storage labels.
For any size GHS labeling solution, check out our third method: Brady’s Client Services
offering. Brady’s group of in-house safety practitioners can come to your facility or
lab to help you understand how to successfully implement new Hazcom and GHS regulatory requirements.
Our Client Services workshops will assist you in giving you the tools you need for making
your facilities lean, compliant, and sustainable practices.
Contact your regional inside sales rep to set up an appointment. To learn more about
GHS labeling and compliance, visit our website, and get started implementing labeling procedures
with Brady!
